a.title: A Message from Our Athletic Director

div.a: A Message from Our Athletic Director

nav.div: Mattituck Cutchogue Union Free School District » News » What's New » COVID-19 Update - April 9, 2020

br.p: I hope this note finds your family keeping busy and staying healthy. As we hear of friends, relatives and stories in the news of those who are sick or who have passed away, it is with a heavy heart we send our prayers and condolences. Please know our school community is with you in spirit.

On April 6th, Governor Cuomo issued another Executive Order that declared schools closed through Wednesday, April 29th. I am awaiting guidance as to the content of this Executive Order, but wanted to share with you what we know thus far. Thank you to all of our families who are social distancing and flattening the curve. This will allow for students and staff to hopefully reunite sooner. Our school family recognizes being homebound is a challenge and we want you to know we are making every effort to adjust, respond and revisit our plans each week as needed.
Below are some important updates since my last message:

For our students in Grades 8-12, the Board of Regents provided a guidance document to districts outlining plans for the Regents exams previously scheduled to take place in June. These exams are cancelled! With that said, students will receive Regents credit based on a number of factors;

ul.li: Students must be or have been enrolled and pass the Regents course for the year to earn the Regents credit.
Students will be eligible to receive Advanced Regents credit should they have earned 85% or better (Mastery) in the course for the year.

li.p: Teachers in Regents level courses will be administering a “local final exam” which will include Regents level material. The majority of the content of these exams will be inclusive of instruction through March 12th; however, depending on the course, there may be material from our distance learning experience included.

ul.li: Teachers will be expected to provide “review” for these exams during the regularly scheduled classes.
It is expected the “local final exam” will be weighted in the 4th quarter average. (More details to follow)
Teachers will be providing more information to students after Tuesday, April 14th. Please give them time to process and plan before asking questions at this time.

br.p: It is with regret, that Mr. Petretti, Mr. Smith and I have concluded that the Disney trip must be cancelled. We waited as long as feasibly possible to make this determination. Fortunately, the District was able to receive a refund for the Disney portion of the trip. We are currently working with Southwest Airlines to reach an agreement on what was originally deemed non-refundable tickets. Either way, the District plans on working with students and families to ensure there is a reasonable solution to this portion of the down payment in this unexpected situation. As we have more information, we will share with the students affected. We will also be returning any unprocessed checks we have not yet deposited at this time. Please give us a few days to work through this. Mr. Petretti and Mr. Smith have all good intentions to plan senior celebrations should we return to school.

As I have said many times throughout this unfortunate pandemic, all of our educators and support personnel have been doing the heavy lifting over the past few weeks – they energize our administrative team with their compassion and commitment to every aspect of this educational journey. Saying thank you will never be enough. Friday will be a month that we have been away from our children, friends and school family. This has been hard on everyone, we miss our students, and the daily interactions with one another more than has been expressed.

Though there are many positives that have surfaced throughout this experience, we have recognized inequities and barriers among children and families. Unfortunately, there have been greater challenges for our most learning disabled and English Language Learners. We have heard and seen loss of jobs and increased fears for others not being able to maintain what was the norm – all of which can have an increased emotional impact on children. We will be adding a Mental Health resource guide to our website. Please do not hesitate to reach out to anyone of our administrators for assistance.

Yet despite some of these barriers and dark moments, we have witnessed incredible generosity, reconnection among family and friends, outreach to the elderly and sick, encouragement to those who need it the most and the greater Mattituck-Cutchogue community come together in ways that have brought comfort and hope to so many. It is these rays of sunshine that have kept us all connected and present for our families and neighbors and mindful of the needs of others.

During this Holy Week, which is celebrated by many of our families, let us honor common themes across faiths: rebirth and renewal. Together, we will overcome this current crisis and through community, faith and/or prayer, return from this with more focused priorities, a stronger sense of purpose and a greater appreciation for the people and things that matter most in our lives.
On behalf of the Mattituck-Cutchogue Board of Education and our leadership team, we wish you and your loved ones a Happy Passover and a Blessed Easter.
